What Is Badger Creek?

Badger Creek is an Outdoor Learning Center owned by Brigham Young University-Idaho. Badger Creek lies in the beautiful Teton Valley. The center spreads across 200 acres of rolling hills and valleys. The Grand Tetons are in panoramic view in the distance. Located four miles north and one mile east of Tetonia, Idaho, off State Highway 33, Badger Creek is within driving distance of many people and has become a site for winter recreational activities, as well as our summer Three-Day Program, Leadership For Life, Parent-Teen Discovery, and Outdoor Youth Adventure (OYA).

To check for availability and to schedule Badger Creek, please call  Megan (208) 456-2531.

Interested in applying to work at Badger Creek? Find out more here.

Note: In order to use the sled hill or any of the facilities at Badger Creek, each member of your group must sign a Liability Waiver . Print  a form for each member of your group. If under 18, a parent or guardian must sign the form. The forms must be given to the person in charge at Badger Creek in order to participate.

A covered pavilion with picnic tables is available. You may cook under this pavilion. You will need to bring your own camp kitchens and pots and pans for cooking. An amphitheater with benches and fire pit is also available.

What Is offered at Badger Creek during the winter?

 

Parent-Teen Discovery is designed to break down boundaries and strengthen family ties by participating in a week-long series of family development workshops, exhilarating ropes courses, and initiatives (Principle-based experiential learning).

Three-Day Programs are offered at Badger Creek during the summer. With the help of a staff of well-trained people, your group will be able to have a character-building experience, while enjoying the great outdoors.

Winter At Badger is an exciting time where families, friends, church youth groups, etc. may schedule overnight or day use of our facilities. Cost is determined by the type of group scheduling and also the type of facility used. Sledding is a popular sport at Badger during the winter, as is cross country skiing.

  • Day and evening use of facilities
  • Overnight lodging
  • Sled Hill with Rope Tow
  • Cross Country Skiing

What Is offered at Badger Creek during the summer?

Evening Groups are offered at Badger Creek for community groups, wards, family reunions, etc. These groups will spend an evening at Badger Creek doing workshops of their choice, with the option of having dinner together also.

Leadership For Life is where youth will engage in various activities emphasizing college and life preparation such as Franklin Covey's "7 Habits of Highly Effective College Students," nightly fireside devotionals, and a special workshop with college prep expert Henry J. Eyring.

Outdoor Youth Adventure (OYA) program is an exhilarating and spiritual five-day adventure. Challenging outdoor workshops are balanced with firesides and daily scripture study.

What  types of lodging and facilities are available at Badger Creek?

Badger Creek  has fairly rustic accommodations.  Depending on the type of program you are attending, the following are available for scheduling:

  • Lodge: Will only be available for scheduling until February 18.
  • Cabins: Will only be available for scheduling until February 18. They sleep six (three bunk beds). The cabins have heat and electricity, but no cooking facilities. Cabins are approximately a five to ten minute walk from the ski hill.
  • Yurts: There are two yurts. One sleeps 12 and one sleeps 20. Both yurts include a wood stove, lanterns, barbeque grill, propane, and cleaning items.
